headline.main: Sarah Palin's Nomination Chances: A Reassessment

docs.abstract: Reassessing Sarah Palin's chances as a potential presidential candidate heading into a new election cycle.
docs.lead_paragraph: In November 2009, I wrote an article entitled "10 Reasons That Sarah Palin Could Win the Republican Nomination." The article wasn't necessarily arguing that she was the favorite to take the nomination, but it did suggest she had a credible chance at it.
docs.snippet: Reassessing Sarah Palin's chances as a potential presidential candidate heading into a new election cycle.

docs.abstract: As more and more people consider surgery for weight loss, it's important to calculate all of the associated costs before deciding whether it's the right choice for you.
docs.lead_paragraph: As obesity rates continue to rise, more and more people are seeking surgery for weight loss. From 1998 to 2004, the number of bariatric operations performed in the United States rose 804 percent. While insurance may cover much of the expense of surgery, the high costs of care following the operation often catch patients by surprise. Lesley Alderman explains in today's Patient Money column:
docs.snippet: As more and more people consider surgery for weight loss, it's important to calculate all of the associated costs before deciding whether it's the right choice for you.

headline.seo: Health Problems Plague Mother and Daughter - Neediest Cases
headline.print_headline: Mother and Daughter Persevere Despite Health Problems
headline.main: Mother and Daughter Persevere Despite Health Problems

docs.lead_paragraph: Emotional and financial burdens have plagued Marie Troy, who suffered complications from gastric bypass surgery, and her 17-year-old daughter, who has severe asthma.
docs.snippet: Emotional and financial burdens have plagued Marie Troy, who suffered complications from gastric bypass surgery, and her 17-year-old daughter, who has severe asthma.
